content.body: wrt number of variables... should we put bounds on the algorithmic complexity of variable.run/get like we do for Map/Set?

> <@devsnek:matrix.org> wrt number of variables... should we put bounds on the algorithmic complexity of variable.run/get like we do for Map/Set? 

You mean, tell everyone they are expected to optimize for >100 variables? I am not sure; maybe it is OK for people to decide that they are slow. We don’t do this for objects.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @devsnek:matrix.org
wrt number of variables... should we put bounds on the algorithmic complexity of variable.run/get like we do for Map/Set?
You mean, tell everyone they are expected to optimize for >100 variables? I am not sure; maybe it is OK for people to decide that they are slow. We don’t do this for objects.

content.body: well specifically just because we specify them with lists

> <@devsnek:matrix.org> wouldn't that mean every time the execution context changes we need to copy the value over
